summaries.brief_summary: Modes system enhancements, SIMD intrinsics expansion, slambda IR introduction, and metaprogramming improvements
summaries.new_features_summary: Added shareable mode, -dslambda flag, slambda IR with static evaluation, SIMD load/store intrinsics, and .cms file installation
summaries.new_features:
- **Shareable mode** added to portability axis, distinguishing functions that capture shared state and can execute in parallel from portable (contended) and nonportable (uncontended) functions ([#4982](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4982))
- **Slambda intermediate representation** introduced as new compilation phase between lambda and static evaluation, with `-dslambda` flag for debugging ([#4776](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4776))
- **SIMD load/store intrinsics** for all SSE and AVX operations using memory operands, including specialized handling for maskmovdqu with implicit RDI addressing ([#4994](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4994), [#4988](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4988))
- **Global implies aliased** constraint enforced syntactically, preventing unsound `@@ global unique` combinations for future borrowing implementation ([#4889](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4889))
- **Mode hints for containing** relationships added between containers (tuples, records, arrays) and their elements, improving error messages ([#4919](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4919))
- **Share context moved to mode hints** through new `Is_used_in` hint and `Const_closure_lock`, replacing previous share_context mechanism ([#4983](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4983))
- **Mod bound parsing refactored** to reuse modality logic with canonical axis ordering in output ([#4931](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4931))
- **Camlinternaleval shared JIT** allowing mdx to reuse bindings across fragments without bundle mechanism ([#4900](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4900), [#4909](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4909), [#4899](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4899))
- **Exception declaration location fixes** preventing dummy error locations in derived code ([#4993](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4993), [#4996](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4996))
- **Coerced application tail position** fix ensuring type_argument correctly marks non-tail expressions ([#4999](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4999))
- **Mixed block approximations** handling in classic mode to prevent assertions when importing non-value types ([#4989](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4989))
- **SIMD sign extension removal** for int8/int16 vector casts as frontend now handles sign-extension automatically ([#4987](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4987))
- **Probes support removal** for deprecated Closure middle end ([#4990](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4990))
- **Installation of .cms files** alongside .cmt files for debug information and Merlin integration, adding 352 files (~4 MB) ([#5005](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5005))
- **Scannable axes parsing** infrastructure with `non_pointer` and `maybe_pointer` annotations (warnings disabled by default) ([#4992](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4992))
summaries.activity_summary: Twenty-seven new PRs opened covering pointerness axes, jkind normalization, probes, metaprogramming, and GC optimizations
summaries.activity:
- **New PRs opened** include downstream of [ocaml/ocaml#13866](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13866) for `occur_rec` optimization by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) ([#5015](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5015)), unboxed module elements allowing non-value fields by [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4) ([#4020](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4020)), `Tof_jkind` for unboxed existentials by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) ([#4995](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4995)), pointerness as scannable axis by [Zack Eisbach](https://github.com/zackbach) ([#5006](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5006)), runtime metaprogramming extension by [Andrej Ivašković](https://github.com/Dreian) ([#5012](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5012)), and fuel increase to 10 with linear normalization by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) ([#5009](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5009))
- **Backend and infrastructure work** progressing with `.cmxs` format changes for import headers by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) ([#5014](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5014)), debug info ordering fix between `Name_for_debugger` and stack spilling ([#5013](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5013)), unoptimized probes implementation by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([#4991](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4991)) and [Greta Yorsh](https://github.com/gretay-js) ([#5007](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5007)), probes refactoring ([#5011](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5011)), compile-time arch constants ([#4972](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4972)), and x86 peephole optimization for dead register moves by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([#4985](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4985))
- **Metrics and CI improvements** delivered through per-artifact size tracking instead of aggregation by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([#5003](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5003)), profile collection alongside artifact sizes ([#5004](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5004)), CFG instruction equality functions ([#5002](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5002)), and `-dump-dir` race condition fix ([#5010](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5010))
- **Type system and modes development** advancing with metaprogramming review by [Jack Rickard](https://github.com/Skepfyr) ([#4981](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4981)), arrays of GC-ignorable values by [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) ([#4963](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4963)), crossing parsing support by [Zack Eisbach](https://github.com/zackbach) ([#4781](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4781)), limited `mod contended` inference ([#4929](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4929)), and `Typeopt.value_kind` level preservation ([#4549](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4549))
- **Debugging infrastructure work** including LLDB OxCaml language plugin by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) ([#4961](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4961)), function sections with DWARF support ([#4934](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4934)), and reversible name mangling scheme by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) ([#4850](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4850))
- **Runtime and GC optimization** explored through effect primitives refactoring removing `Must_not_enter_gc` by [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) ([#4901](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4901)), preemption implementation ([#4881](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4881)), and major GC marking loop optimization by [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) ([#4997](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4997))
- **Miscellaneous improvements** including manifest files support by [Andrei Odintsov](https://github.com/Forestryks) ([#4986](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4986)), dune version documentation update by [Sadiq Jaffer](https://github.com/sadiqj) ([#5000](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5000)), and Ccatch simplification for boolean computation by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([#4998](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4998))
summaries.discussions_summary: Upstream collaboration on occur_rec optimization with discussion on performance impact and benchmark plans
summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Upstream downstreaming coordination** for [ocaml/ocaml#13866](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13866) involving [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) who provided the upstream fix that [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) is downstreaming, with [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) planning performance benchmarks ([#5015](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5015))
- **Mixed module implementation review** for top-level unboxed elements with detailed discussions on module representations, coercions, parameterized libraries, and toplevel limitations between [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4), [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls), [Chris Casinghino](https://github.com/ccasin), and [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([#4020](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4020))
- **Jkind normalization approach** discussion between [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) and [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) on using `Tof_jkind` versus tracking existentials, with questions about `fixed` parameter usage and type levels ([#4995](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4995))
- **GC-ignorable arrays semantics** clarification between [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) and [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) regarding `caml_modify` skipping and scanner behavior for external values ([#4963](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4963))
- **Scannable axes design decisions** between [Zack Eisbach](https://github.com/zackbach) and [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) covering warning messages, parsetree structure, CR conventions, and terminology choices for kind modifiers ([#4992](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4992))
summaries.trends_summary: Intensifying focus on modes system refinement, SIMD intrinsics completion, metaprogramming infrastructure, and performance optimization
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Modes system maturation** evident through shareable mode addition, mode hints refactoring, crossing infrastructure, and global-aliased constraints representing systematic expansion of the modes type system
- **SIMD intrinsics buildout** continuing with load/store operations, memory operand generalization, and addressing mode support showing commitment to complete SIMD instruction coverage
- **Metaprogramming infrastructure** development through slambda IR, Camlinternaleval improvements, translquote review, and runtime metaprogramming extension indicating preparation for staged compilation
- **Type system sophistication** advancing with pointerness axes, jkind normalization fuel increases, unboxed module elements, and GC-ignorable arrays extending layout expressiveness
- **Debugging tooling investment** through .cms file installation, DWARF improvements, name mangling, and LLDB plugin demonstrating focus on developer experience
- **Performance optimization efforts** spanning GC marking loops, peephole optimizations, and profile collection infrastructure showing attention to runtime efficiency
- **Upstream coordination** visible through occur_rec downstreaming and collaboration with [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) maintaining connection with upstream OCaml development
summaries.contributors_summary: Sixteen contributors active with work spanning modes, SIMD, metaprogramming, type system, debugging, and runtime optimization
summaries.contributors:
- [@liam923](https://github.com/liam923) downstreamed [ocaml/ocaml#13866](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13866) for `occur_rec` optimization ([#5015](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5015)), implemented `Tof_jkind` for unboxed existentials and Tpolys ([#4995](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4995)), and increased jkind normalization fuel to 10 with linear caching ([#5009](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5009))
- [@TheNumbat](https://github.com/TheNumbat) implemented SIMD load/store intrinsics ([#4994](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4994)), generalized SIMD memory operands ([#4988](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4988)), added shareable mode ([#4982](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4982)), and removed SIMD sign extension ([#4987](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4987))
- [@spiessimon](https://github.com/spiessimon) installed .cms files alongside .cmt files ([#5005](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5005)), worked on .cmxs format changes ([#5014](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5014)), fixed debug info ordering ([#5013](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5013)), developed LLDB language plugin ([#4961](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4961)), enabled function sections with DWARF ([#4934](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4934)), and reviewed various backend PRs
- [@xclerc](https://github.com/xclerc) refactored metrics for per-artifact tracking ([#5003](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5003)) and profile collection ([#5004](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5004)), added CFG equality functions ([#5002](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5002)), fixed dump-dir race condition ([#5010](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5010)), implemented x86 peephole optimization ([#4985](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4985)), and explored Ccatch boolean simplification ([#4998](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4998))
- [@zackbach](https://github.com/zackbach) added pointerness as scannable axis ([#5006](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5006)), implemented scannable axes parsing ([#4992](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4992)), developed crossing parsing support ([#4781](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4781)), and worked on limited mod contended inference ([#4929](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4929))
- [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) implemented arrays of GC-ignorable values ([#4963](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4963)), refactored mod bound parsing ([#4931](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4931)), enforced global implies aliased ([#4889](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4889)), preserved levels in Typeopt.value_kind ([#4549](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4549)), and reviewed modes-related PRs
- [@gretay-js](https://github.com/gretay-js) developed unoptimized probes implementation ([#5007](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5007)), refactored probes code generation ([#5011](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5011)), added compile-time arch constants ([#4972](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4972)), and reviewed SIMD PRs
- [@mshinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) removed probes support for old Closure ([#4990](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4990)), implemented unoptimized probes ([#4991](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4991)), fixed Camlinternaleval for mdx ([#4900](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4900)), handled No_such_module in Cm_bundle ([#4909](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4909)), and fixed camlinternaleval link order ([#4899](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4899))
- [@riaqn](https://github.com/riaqn) moved share_context to mode hints ([#4983](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4983)), fixed exception declaration attributes location ([#4996](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4996)), and added mode hints for containing ([#4919](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4919))
- [@lukemaurer](https://github.com/lukemaurer) introduced slambda IR with trivial translation and evaluation ([#4776](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4776))
- [@lthls](https://github.com/lthls) fixed mixed block approximation import in classic mode ([#4989](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4989)) and provided detailed reviews on mixed modules PR ([#4020](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4020))
- [@Skepfyr](https://github.com/Skepfyr) marked coerced applications as nontail ([#4999](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4999)) and reviewed translquote implementation ([#4981](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4981))
- [@mdelvecchio-jsc](https://github.com/mdelvecchio-jsc) fixed exception declaration location ([#4993](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4993))
- [@jra4](https://github.com/jra4) developed unboxed module elements support ([#4020](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4020))
- [@NickBarnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) optimized GC marking loop by eliminating global accesses ([#4997](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4997))
- [@Dreian](https://github.com/Dreian) added runtime metaprogramming extension ([#5012](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5012)) and reviewed translquote ([#4981](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4981))
- [@glittershark](https://github.com/glittershark) refactored effect primitives ([#4901](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4901)) and worked on preemption ([#4881](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4881))
- [@tmcgilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) developed reversible name mangling scheme ([#4850](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4850))
- [@Forestryks](https://github.com/Forestryks) added manifest files support ([#4986](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4986))
- [@sadiqj](https://github.com/sadiqj) updated dune version in README ([#5000](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5000))
- [@Octachron](https://github.com/Octachron) provided upstream occur_rec optimization that was downstreamed ([#5015](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5015))
- [@goldfirere](https://github.com/goldfirere), [@ccasin](https://github.com/ccasin), and [@rtjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) provided reviews across multiple PRs

summaries.brief_summary: Significant progress on modes, SIMD support, and Unix module annotations with 34 PRs merged and 17 new PRs opened.
summaries.new_features_summary: F16C/FMA intrinsics, domain index API, TLS primitive, quiet flag for ocamldebug, and untagged char range patterns.
summaries.new_features:
- **F16C and FMA SIMD intrinsics** added with new `Float16x8`, `Float16x16`, and `Float16x32` vector types for half-precision floating-point operations, plus fused multiply-add support ([#4964](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4964))
- **Domain index API** exposed via `Domain.self_index()` to get a unique integer identifier for the current domain, in range [0; N-1] where N is the peak number of simultaneously running domains ([#4950](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4950))
- **Thread-local storage primitive** `%tls_get` added for accessing thread-local state blocks, complementing the existing domain-local state ([#4959](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4959))
- **Untagged char range patterns** now supported (e.g., `#'a'..#'z'`) with improved match exhaustion checking for small integers and unboxed ints ([#4729](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4729))
- **Unix module local annotations** added to parameters in functions like `execv`, `execve`, `openfile`, `read`, `write`, `stat`, `lstat`, and many file operations to support locality modes ([#4830](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4830))
- **Quiet flag for ocamldebug** (`-quiet`) suppresses printing while executing initialization files, useful for cleaner startup in scripts ([#4869](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4869))
- **Locking scheme version** added to track runtime locking protocol changes ([#4958](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4958))
- **Stdlib local annotations** now printed for standard library functions to improve visibility of locality mode constraints ([#4943](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4943))
- **Hole expressions** (`Pexp_hole`) now parsed as simple expressions, improving error handling and type checking ([#4956](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4956))
- **Skiplist for natdynlink roots** in the runtime improves performance of dynamic linking ([#4949](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4949))
summaries.activity_summary: 17 new PRs opened including SIMD enhancements and peephole optimizations, with 34 PRs merged covering modes, quotations, and tooling.
summaries.activity:
- **New PRs opened** this week include [#4987](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4987) and [#4988](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4988) for SIMD improvements (stop sign-extending small int casts, generalize memory operands), [#4982](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4982) for a new `sharable` mode, [#4983](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4983) to move `share_context` to mode hints, and several WIP PRs from [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) on **x86 peephole optimizations** ([#4973](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4973), [#4975](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4975), [#4977](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4977), [#4985](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4985))
- **Mode system improvements** were a major theme with [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) contributing [#4792](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4792) (convert mode to constant in cmi), [#4984](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4984) (disallow legacy mode syntax in comprehension), [#4968](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4968) (compiler no longer prints old mode/modality syntax), [#4979](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4979) (remove excessive parentheses in mode error hints), and [#4978](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4978) (add missing Skip hints for monadic modes)
- **Quotations and splicing** saw fixes with [Jakub Bachurski](https://github.com/jbachurski) landing [#4974](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4974) for inclusion checks with quotes and splices, [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25) fixing quotation unification in [#4906](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4906), and [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) fixing constructor quotation locks in [#4910](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4910)
- **Compiler internals** improved with [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) making module finding lazy in [#4970](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4970), [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) removing global state from Linkenv in [#4947](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4947), and [Luke Maurer](https://github.com/lukemaurer) fixing a segfault by disallowing aliases to parameter modules in [#4948](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4948)
- **Type system and jkinds** work included [Andrej Ivašković](https://github.com/Dreian) adding levels to sort variables in [#4785](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4785), [Dmitrii Kalinichenko](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) fixing `or_null` with default optional arguments in [#4953](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4953) and landing [#4891](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4891) for exceptions crossing statefulness and visibility
- **Documentation and tooling** updates included [Max Slater](https://github.com/TheNumbat) fixing tutorial typos in [#4954](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4954) and [#4969](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4969), [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) rewording allocation hints in [#4957](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4957), and [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) restoring oxcaml-metrics push in [#4967](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4967)
summaries.trends_summary: Heavy focus on mode system refinements, SIMD capabilities expansion, and compiler optimization infrastructure.
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Mode system maturation** with migration away from legacy syntax and improved error messages, showing the modes feature is stabilizing
- **SIMD expansion** continues with F16C/FMA support and ongoing work on memory operands and cast improvements
- **Performance optimization focus** evident in peephole optimization work, lazy module finding, and skiplist for natdynlink
- **Locality mode annotations** spreading through standard library (Unix module) with better tooling support (printing local annotations)
summaries.contributors_summary: 24 contributors active with significant contributions from Zesen Qian (modes), Max Slater (SIMD), and Xavier Clerc (optimizations).
summaries.contributors:
- [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) led **mode system refinements** with 11 merged PRs covering legacy syntax removal, error message improvements, and mode compilation ([#4792](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4792), [#4984](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4984), [#4968](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4968), [#4979](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4979), [#4978](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4978), [#4966](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4966), [#4910](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4910), [#4952](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4952), [#4957](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4957), [#4980](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4980))
- [Max Slater](https://github.com/TheNumbat) contributed **SIMD enhancements** with F16C/FMA intrinsics, TLS primitive, SIMD cleanups, and opened 3 new SIMD PRs ([#4964](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4964), [#4959](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4959), [#4965](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4965), [#4987](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4987), [#4988](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4988), [#4982](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4982))
- [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) opened **5 WIP PRs on x86 peephole optimizations** targeting instruction list improvements and move elimination ([#4973](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4973), [#4975](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4975), [#4976](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4976), [#4977](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4977), [#4985](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4985))
- [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4) implemented **untagged char range patterns** with improved match exhaustion ([#4729](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4729))
- [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) contributed **Unix module locality annotations** and exposed the domain index API ([#4830](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4830), [#4950](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4950))
- [Jakub Bachurski](https://github.com/jbachurski) added the **ocamldebug quiet flag** and fixed inclusion checks with quotations ([#4869](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4869), [#4974](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4974))
- [Dmitrii Kalinichenko](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) worked on **jkinds and nullability** with fixes for `or_null`, exceptions crossing statefulness, and opened a PR for gc-ignorable value arrays ([#4953](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4953), [#4891](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4891), [#4963](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4963))
- [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) refactored **compiler internals** removing global state from Linkenv ([#4947](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4947))
- [Luke Maurer](https://github.com/lukemaurer) fixed a **segfault** by disallowing aliases to parameter modules ([#4948](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4948))
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) optimized **module lookup** to be lazy ([#4970](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4970))
- [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25) fixed **quotation unification** issues ([#4906](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4906))
- [Andrej Ivašković](https://github.com/Dreian) added **levels to sort variables** ([#4785](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4785))
- [Thibaut Koukpari](https://github.com/tkoukpari) added **local annotations printing** to stdlib functions ([#4943](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4943), [#4962](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4962))
- [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) added **locking scheme versioning** ([#4958](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4958))
- [Nicolas Trangez](https://github.com/NicolasT) implemented **skiplist for natdynlink** roots ([#4949](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4949))
- [Nailen Matschke](https://github.com/nmatschke) improved **hole expression parsing** ([#4956](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4956))
- [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere), [Greta Yorsh](https://github.com/gretay-js), [Andrei Odintsov](https://github.com/Forestryks), [Jack Rickard](https://github.com/Skepfyr), and [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) opened new PRs for ongoing work on type system improvements, compile-time constants, manifest files, quotations, and LLDB integration

summaries.brief_summary: Thread naming support, Flambda2 type system improvements, CI infrastructure upgrades, and DWARF debugging enhancements
summaries.new_features_summary: Thread.set_current_thread_name API, improved locking scheme interface, CI runner upgrades, and metrics collection enhancements
summaries.new_features:
- **Thread naming support** added via `Thread.set_current_thread_name` function backported from upstream OCaml, allowing developers to set thread names for improved debugging in GDB and stacktraces ([#4946](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4946))
- **Extended locking scheme interface** with `caml_domain_send_interrupt_hook` callback for better backup thread interactions in multi-domain programs using non-default locking schemes, improving Python integration support ([#4914](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4914))
- **Native Dynlink fix** for parameterized modules now correctly uses `Compilation_unit.full_path_as_string` instead of `name_as_string` to distinguish compilation units differing only by arguments ([#4935](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4935))
- **DWARF test improvements** with pedantic mode enabled by default and new test coverage for closures, larger data structures, tuples, and bigarrays to prevent regressions ([#4626](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4626))
- **CI infrastructure upgrades** deploying larger GitHub Actions runners across all CI jobs for improved build performance ([#4908](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4908))
- **Metrics collection modernization** translating bash scripts to Python with type annotations and extensible CSV format supporting different metric types beyond artifact sizes ([#4926](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4926), [#4927](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4927))
- **Test infrastructure fix** for swapgil stubs setting `send_interrupt` to NULL for runtime 5 compatibility ([#4933](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4933))
- **Build system cleanup** removing unnecessary VERSION file installation to match upstream OCaml ([#4924](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4924))
summaries.activity_summary: Flambda2 type system work, modality system improvements, DWARF debugging advances, and parameterized modules refinements
summaries.activity:
- **Flambda2 type system enhancement** with relations stored as projections in type kinds, enabling precise tracking during n-way joins for the match-in-match heuristic by [Basile Clément](https://github.com/bclement-ocp) with extensive review from [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) ([#4390](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4390))
- **Profiling infrastructure** for speculative inlining added by [Basile Clément](https://github.com/bclement-ocp) to better understand compilation behavior ([#4375](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4375))
- **Domain index exposure** proposed by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) adding `Domain.self_index` API for per-domain array elements to avoid contention, referencing upstream [ocaml/ocaml#13171](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13171) ([#4950](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4950))
- **Linkenv refactoring** by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) removing global state to simplify code and support future work, under review by [Jack Rickard](https://github.com/Skepfyr) ([#4947](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4947))
- **Natdynlink performance** improvement using skiplist instead of linked list for module GC roots by [Nicolas Trangez](https://github.com/NicolasT), enabling efficient duplicate checking during dynamic linking ([#4949](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4949))
- **Parameterized modules segfault fix** disallowing aliases to parameter modules to prevent signature substitution issues until transparent ascription is available ([#4948](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4948))
- **DWARF debugging advances** including layout improvements for runtime type information by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) ([#4916](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4916)), shape constructors for unknown types ([#4928](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4928)), function sections support ([#4934](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4934)), and phantom variable support by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([#4595](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4595))
- **Modality system work** with `@@ global` implying `@@ aliased` for borrowing soundness by [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) ([#4889](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4889)), mod bound parsing refactoring ([#4931](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4931)), mod contended inference ([#4929](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4929), [#4944](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4944)), exceptions crossing statefulness and visibility ([#4891](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4891)), and stdlib stateless annotations ([#4839](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4839), [#4930](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4930))
- **Stdlib local annotations** for printing functions by [@tkoukpari](https://github.com/tkoukpari) across multiple iterations ([#4937](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4937), [#4938](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4938), [#4943](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4943))
- **Mixed modules progress** with automatic field reordering by [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4) ([#4020](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4020)) and unsigned divmod work ([#4936](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4936))
- **Layout system improvements** using `Lambda.layout` for `transl_exp` and preserving levels in `Typeopt.value_kind` by [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) ([#4582](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4582), [#4549](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4549))
- **Type system testing** adding jkind subsumption across files test by [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) with review from [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) ([#4922](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4922))
- **Backend optimizations** including CFG peephole rules for neutral elements ([#4932](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4932)), float value propagation ([#4879](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4879)), terminator simplification extensions ([#4807](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4807)), and CFG reducibility work by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([#4920](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4920), [#4921](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4921))
- **Name mangling scheme** development by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) enabling reversible demangling with full module paths for improved debugging ([#4850](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4850))
- **Preemption support** ongoing work by [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) ([#4881](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4881))
- **Runtime improvements** including memprof configuration on major heap by [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) ([#4939](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4939)) and to_cmm illegal reordering prevention by [Guillaume Bury](https://github.com/Gbury) ([#4941](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4941))
- **CI metrics enhancement** for compiler profile data collection by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([#4942](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4942))
- **Frametables configuration** option for `.lrodata` placement to handle large code sizes by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([#4905](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4905))
- **Match-in-match heuristic** development with improved naked immediate meets by [Basile Clément](https://github.com/bclement-ocp) ([#4374](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4374), [#4394](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4394))
summaries.trends_summary: Focus on type system refinements, debugging infrastructure, and modality system maturation
summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Type system sophistication** continuing with Flambda2 relations as projections enabling more precise optimization analysis and the match-in-match heuristic requiring careful handling of type variance
- **Debugging infrastructure maturation** across DWARF generation, phantom variables, name mangling, and test coverage indicating production readiness priorities
- **Modality system evolution** with stateless, contended, aliased, and portable annotations being refined through stdlib usage and soundness fixes
- **Parameterized modules refinement** addressing edge cases in Dynlink and alias handling while automatic field reordering enables mixed module support
- **Infrastructure modernization** with Python replacing bash scripts, CI runner upgrades, and extensible metrics collection supporting performance tracking
- **Backend optimization focus** on CFG analysis including value propagation, reducibility checking, and peephole optimizations for better code generation
- **Concurrent programming support** through preemption work, locking scheme extensions, thread naming, and domain-aware primitives
summaries.contributors_summary: 15 contributors with work spanning runtime, type system, debugging, CI, and modality features
summaries.contributors:
- [Basile Clément](https://github.com/bclement-ocp) merged Flambda2 type system improvements storing relations as projections with extensive n-way join handling ([#4390](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4390)) and profiling infrastructure for speculative inlining ([#4375](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4375)), with ongoing match-in-match heuristic work ([#4374](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4374), [#4394](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4394))
- [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) backported `Thread.set_current_thread_name` from upstream OCaml with testing ([#4946](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4946)), added jkind subsumption test ([#4922](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4922)), and continues preemption implementation ([#4881](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4881))
- [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) modernized metrics collection translating bash to Python ([#4926](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4926)), made CSV format generic ([#4927](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4927)), and developed CFG optimizations including peephole rules ([#4932](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4932)), float propagation ([#4879](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4879)), reducibility checking ([#4920](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4920)), and terminator simplification ([#4807](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4807), [#4921](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4921)), plus CI profile metrics ([#4942](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4942))
- [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) merged DWARF test enhancements with pedantic mode and new coverage ([#4626](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4626)), contributed shape constructors for unknown types ([#4928](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4928)), and works on layout improvements ([#4916](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4916)) and function sections support ([#4934](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4934)), with reviews on metrics PRs
- [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) fixed swapgil test stubs ([#4933](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4933)), refactored Linkenv removing global state ([#4947](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4947)), continues phantom variable support ([#4595](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4595)), and develops frametables configuration ([#4905](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4905))
- [Luke Maurer](https://github.com/lukemaurer) fixed parameterized modules Dynlink ([#4935](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4935)) and addresses alias segfault ([#4948](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4948))
- [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) extended locking scheme interface with interrupt hooks ([#4914](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4914)) and works on memprof improvements ([#4939](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4939))
- [Jacob Van Buren](https://github.com/jvanburen) enabled new CI runners ([#4908](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4908)) and added CI warnings ([#4867](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4867))
- [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) removed VERSION installation ([#4924](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4924)) and develops modality system improvements including global/aliased implications ([#4889](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4889)), mod bound refactoring ([#4931](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4931)), exception crossing ([#4891](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4891)), stdlib annotations ([#4839](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4839), [#4930](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4930)), Lambda.layout usage ([#4582](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4582)), and Typeopt improvements ([#4549](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4549))
- [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) provided extensive review on Flambda2 relations PR with detailed feedback on type grammar consistency ([#4390](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4390))
- [Jack Rickard](https://github.com/Skepfyr) reviews Linkenv refactoring examining API mutability and potential re-entry issues ([#4947](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4947))
